title: Teardown always runs - implementation details
body:
v0.27.0 adds guaranteed teardown execution:

1. Teardown runs even when setup fails (was returning early before)
2. Teardown runs on SIGINT/SIGTERM (ctrlc crate with termination feature)
3. Added ignore_interruption param to run_corpus_file for teardown

Signal handling gotcha: When cctr runs in a subshell (bash -c), signal handling may not work reliably because the process can be terminated before teardown runs. Works correctly when cctr runs directly.

Key code changes:
- run_suite no longer returns early on setup failure
- Added is_interrupted() check between tests (but not for teardown)
- run_teardown_if_exists passes ignore_interruption=true
